general health officer  office created appointment duties a there is hereby created the office of health officer the city manager shall appoint some suitable person to the office of health officer with the consent of a majority vote of the city council the health officer shall hold his office during the pleasure of the city manager subject to majority approval by the city council the health officer shall perform such duties as are prescribed by law or ordinance or directed by the council or city manager in matters relating to health b the city manager is hereby authorized to appoint the county public health center to act as health officer for and on behalf of the city this appointment is subject to the approval of the city council  21589 cross reference administration ch 2  removal of weeds  22112 et seq state department of health regulations adopted  penalty a the city hereby adopts the regulations of the state department of health contained in missouri state regulations 20 entitled sanitation of foodservice establishments and missouri state regulations 20 entitled sanitation of retail food stores these regulations shall govern retail food stores and food service sanitation within the city and the health officer shall enforce these regulations pursuant to his authority granted therein b any person violating any of these regulations shall upon conviction thereof be punished as prescribed in section 18 of this  21589 city water to be fluoridated a required all publicly supplied water used for human consumption in the city shall contain sufficient fluoride content to maintain a fluoride ion concentration of approximately one 1 part of fluoride to one million 1000000 parts of water b public utilities to comply with state requirements all public utilities or others supplying public water used for human consumption shall comply with the lawful requirements directives and orders of the state department of natural resources with reference to installing the equipment used and the method followed in introducing fluoride into such water supplies c health officer to cooperate with state the health officer and personnel of his department shall cooperate with the state department of natural resources in conducting surveys and research as to the effect of fluoridation of water on the dental health of the residents of the city  cross reference water and sewers ch 29 secs 1341330  reserved article ii  nuisances footnotes  2  cross reference weeds  22111 et seq state law reference suppression of nuisances rsmo   et seq   removal of nuisances at cost of owner or occupant rsmo   division 1  generally defined the following are hereby declared to be nuisances 1 any act done or committed or suffered to be done or committed by any person or any substance or thing kept maintained placed or found in or upon any public or private place within this city which is injurious dangerous annoying unsafe or offensive to the public 2 any pursuit followed or act done or omission failed to be done by any person which is injurious dangerous annoying unsafe or offensive to the public 3 any building bridge or other structure which is unsafe dangerous injurious unhealthy offensive or annoying to the public 4 any slaughterhouse stockyard or stable cattleyard hog sheep or cow pen which is offensive injurious obnoxious unsafe or annoying to the public 5 any pond or pool of stagnant water or any foul or dirty water or liquid discharged drainpipe or spout or thrown into or upon the street alley thoroughfare or lot which is injurious dangerous offensive unhealthy or unsafe to the public 6 any obstruction caused or permitted on any street sidewalk public or private alley which is injurious dangerous offensive inconvenient unsafe or unhealthy to the public 7 any stone dirt filth slops vegetable matter animal matter or other articles thrown or placed in or upon any street alley sidewalk or other public place which is injurious dangerous obnoxious unsafe or offensive to the public 8 the placing or storage of any green or salted hides which cause an odor which is injurious dangerous obnoxious offensive unhealthy or unsafe to the public 9 any animal or vegetable matter or other substance liable to become putrid offensive or unhealthy which is injurious dangerous unhealthy unsafe and offensive to the public 10 any cellar vault private drain pool privy sewer sink or container which may be sufficiently tightly closed to cause suffocation which is injurious dangerous unsafe or offensive to the public health 11 any tenement boardinghouse or lodginghouse in the city leased let rented or occupied by any person for dwelling which is not sufficiently lighted ventilated heated or provided with water or kept in a clean and sanitary condition which is dangerous injurious obnoxious offensive or unsafe to the public 12 any house or building or tank within the city used for the special or exclusive storage of powders or dynamite with a glycerine coal oil or other explosive substance detrimental to the public health or endangering human life or any house building or store wherein small quantities of such explosives are kept exposed or insecure or kept in any manner so as to endanger the public 13 a radio television set or musical instrument or device operated in such manner or at such hours which are injurious inconvenient obnoxious offensive or annoying to the public or persons living or doing business nearby 14 any growth of weeds grass or poisonous or harmful vegetation to a greater height than ten 10 inches on the average within two hundred 200 feet of any building or one hundred 100 feet of any improved street or any accumulation of dead weeds grass or brush within two hundred 200 feet of any building or one hundred 100 feet of any improved street 15 any swimming pool which is not surrounded by a fence or wall not less than four 4 feet in height having no openings or holes larger than four 4 inches in any dimension except for doors and gates such doors and gates to be latched or closed and locked when the swimming pool is not in use and such doors and gates to be outfitted with handles latches or locks of such a nature so as to thwart any efforts by an infant or small child to open such doors or gates for the purpose of this section a swimming pool shall be defined as an artificial receptacle containing a body of water used or intended to be used for public semipublic or private swimming 16 any unwanted or discarded waste materials in a solid or semisolid state including but not limited to garbage ashes street refuse rubbish dead animals animal and agricultural wastes yard wastes discarded appliances industrial wastes and demolition and construction wastes or items kept placed or stored outside of a building which are not being used as designed and which pose a threat to the health safety or welfare of the public or any items that have deteriorated to such an extent that they are incapable of being used for their intended purpose or items not kept in an orderly clean sanitary weed free condition or which may collect water in an unsanitary manner such that they pose a threat to the health safety or welfare of the public   art 1 2204 unlawful to cause maintain within onehalf mile of city it is unlawful for any owner lessee or occupant or any agent servant representative or employee of any such owner lessee or occupant having control of any occupied lot or land or any part thereof in the city or within onehalf mile of the city limits to permit or maintain a nuisance on any such lot or land  state law reference nuisances rsmo   authority to abate emergency cases in cases where it reasonably appears that there is an immediate danger to the health safety or welfare of the public due to the existence of a nuisance the city manager shall have the authority to order the chief of police or health officer or other city official to immediately abate the nuisance in an appropriate manner  abatement procedure for nuisances generally  high weedsgrass a abatement notice  when a nuisance or violation exists in violation of or of this an abatement notice shall be served on the owner of the property where the violation is believed to exist an abatement notice must be served on the owner of the property upon which the violation is believed to exist only if abatement costs are to be assessed against the property the abatement notice shall contain the following 1 description of the location and nature of the alleged violation  2 statement of the acts necessary to abate the alleged violation  3 a deadline for abating the alleged violation  4 information on the right and manner of requesting a hearing to contest the violation declaration  and 5 a statement that if the violation is not abated as ordered and if no request for hearing is made within the prescribed time the city or persons under contract with the city may enter upon the property and abate the alleged violation and assess the costs against the owner of the property b service of abatement notice  the notice shall be served by at least one of the following methods 1 personal service on the property owner or the owners agent  2 service by mail addressed to the last known address of the owner or the owners agent  or 3 posting the notice on the property where the violation is alleged to exist notice shall be considered given on the date the notice is personally served mailed or posted c abatement hearing officer  the city manager shall designate a member or members of city staff to serve as an abatement hearing officer d request for hearing  the property owner of the property on which the nuisance or violation is alleged to exist may contest the abatement notice by requesting a hearing the request for hearing must be made in writing and received by the city clerk within seven 7 days of service of the abatement notice the request for hearing must be either handdelivered or received by the city clerk by us mail facsimile machine or electronic mail the request for hearing must state the address to which a notice of hearing may be sent e notice of hearing  at least seven 7 days written notice of the hearing shall be given to the person requesting the hearing except in cases where the public health safety or interest shall make a shorter time reasonable notice shall be handdelivered or mailed to the address provided in the request for hearing notice shall be presumed received three 3 days after it is mailed f hearing and decision  the hearing officer shall conduct the hearing and enter a decision if the hearing officer determines that a nuisance or violation exists as charged in the abatement notice the hearing officer may enter an order of abatement directing that the nuisance be abated by the property owner and under such conditions and within such time as the hearing officer deems appropriate under the circumstances or in the alternative or in addition to the hearing officer may enter an order for the city to abate the nuisance or violation g abatement by the city  upon an order by the abatement hearing officer the city or persons under contract with the city may enter upon the property and abate the nuisance or violation and assess the costs against the property owner h collection of abatement costs  the costs to the city for any abatement shall be certified to the city clerk or the director of finance the costs shall include one hundred fifty dollars $15000 in administrative costs as well as the actual costs of the abatement the city clerk or director of finance shall cause a special tax bill against the property to be prepared in the amount of the abatement and administrative costs the tax bill from the date of its issuance shall be a lien on the property until paid and shall be prima facie evidence of the recitals therein and of its validity no clerical error or informality in the tax bill or in the proceedings leading up to the issuance of the tax bill shall be a defense in an action to collect the tax bill tax bills issued under this section shall bear interest at the rate of eight percent 8% per annum the cost of abatement shall also constitute a personal obligation of the property owner unpaid tax bills issued under this chapter shall be a basis to suspend revoke or deny a license issued pursuant to chapters 5 or 15 of this code or to disconnect service provided under of this code license actions or service disconnection actions shall be against the property owner andor for the location of the abated violation or nuisance for which the tax bill was issued art 1 12213 footnotes  3  editors note art 1 adopted dec 2 201 repealed the former  1334 and 1335 and enacted a new  1334 as set out herein the former  1334 pertained to abatement  procedure generally and derived from the  1517  and art 2 81897 the former  1335 pertained to abatement  weeds and derived from the  1518   72092  and art 1 81897 reserved abatement provisions not deemed exclusive the provisions as contained herein for abatement of nuisances shall not be exclusive and the city may pursue any additional remedies it may have as provided by law upon trial and conviction for causing or maintaining a nuisance the cost of removing or abating the nuisance may be made a part of the judgment by the municipal judge in addition to the fine imposed provided however that the additional cost shall be in lieu of the issuance of a tax bill as provided in section 13344 and 5 or section 13353 and 4  enclosure of swimming pools a every outdoor swimming pool or family pool shall be completely surrounded by a fence or wall not less than four 4 feet in height which shall be so constructed as not to have openings holes or gaps larger than four 4 inches in any dimension except for doors and gates  and if a picket fence is erected or maintained the horizontal dimension between pickets shall not exceed four 4 inches a dwelling house or accessory building may be used as part of such enclosure b all gates or doors opening enclosure shall be equipped with a selfclosing and selflatching device for keeping the gate or door securely closed at all times when not in actual use except that the door of any dwelling which forms a part of the enclosure need not be so equipped c this requirement shall be applicable to all new swimming pools or family pools hereafter constructed other than indoor pools and shall apply to all existing pools which have a minimum depth of eighteen 18 inches of water no person in possession of land within the city either as owner purchaser lessee tenant or a licensee upon which is situated a swimming pool or family pool having a minimum depth of eighteen 18 inches shall fail to provide and maintain such fence or wall as herein provided d the health officer may make modifications in individual cases upon a showing of good cause with respect to the height nature or location of the fence wall gates or latches or the necessity therefor provided the protection as sought hereunder is not reduced thereby the health officer may permit other protective devices or structures to be used so long as the degree of protection afforded by the substitute devices or structures is not less than the protection afforded by the wall fence gate and latch described herein the health officer shall allow a reasonable period within which to comply with the requirements of this section  cross reference parks and recreation ch 18 graffiti a graffiti as a nuisance  the existence of graffiti on public or private property is expressly declared to be a public nuisance and therefore is subject to the removal and abatement provisions specified in this section and this chapter b graffiti means any unauthorized inscription word figure painting or other defacement that is written marked etched scratched sprayed drawn painted or engraved on or otherwise affixed to any surface of public or private property to the extent that the display was not lawfully authorized in advance by the owner or occupant of the property thus rendering any advance authorization invalid c duty of property owner and occupant  1 it is the duty of both the owner of the property to which graffiti has been applied and any person who may be in possession or who has the right to possess such property to at all times keep the property clear of graffiti 2 it is the duty of the property owner to abate or cause to be abated graffiti upon notice from the city notice can be served personally by sending notice via us mail or electronic mail or by posting such notice on the property d removal of graffiti by city  if after notice pursuant to paragraph c of this section the owner fails to remove the offending graffiti within fifteen 15 days the city may commence abatement pursuant to the property owner shall be tax billed for the costs art 2 12213 display of certain items prohibited a it shall be unlawful for the owner or occupant of any residence or dwelling to allow any of the following items to remain outside on such premises including but not limited to on any porch deck carport driveway yard or in any location which can be viewed from a location off the premises bedding bottles broken glass cans cardboard cartons furniture manufactured for indoor use only jars lumber and building supply material that are not neatly stacked machine parts motor vehicle parts pallets paper plumbing fixtures inoperable appliances scrap metal tire rims tires water heaters b duty of property owner and occupant  it is the duty of the property owner or occupant to abate or cause to be abated the display of the prohibited items listed in this section upon notice from the city notice can be served personally by sending notice via us mail or electronic mail or by posting such notice on the property c removal of prohibited items  if after notice pursuant to paragraph b of this section the property owner or occupant fails to remove the offending items within seven 7 days the city may commence abatement pursuant to the property owner shall be billed for the costs art 3 12213 secs 13401350  reserved division 2  inoperable vehicles footnotes  4  cross reference traffic ch 26 definitions the the city is hereby declared to be a public nuisance  72489  art 1 102300  art 4 12213 maintenance of nuisance prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to create or maintain a nuisance as provided in this division  72489 notice whenever the chief of police or his duly authorized representative determines that any vehicle is a nuisance under this division he shall cause written notice to be served upon the owner of the vehicle if he can be located or the person in custody of such vehicle by registered mail or by personal service the notice shall state that the vehicle is deemed to be a nuisance within the provisions of section 1352 and shall briefly state facts deemed to constitute such vehicle a nuisance within the terms of this division and state that the nuisance shall be abated within seven 7 days from receipt of such notice  101689 proceedings when owner or custodian cannot be located when the owner or custodian of any nuisance under this division cannot be located by reasonable search the notice shall be attached to the vehicle briefly stating facts deemed to constitute a nuisance and stating that the nuisance shall be abated within seven 7 days of the date notice was posted  101689 duty of the owner or custodian any person receiving the notice provided for in section 1355 shall comply with the provisions of the notice requiring abatement failure to comply with this provision is unlawful  72489 disposition if not removed within the time specified in the notice the vehicle determined to be a nuisance under this division shall be transported to a storage area by or at the direction of the chief of police or his duly authorized representative at the expense of the owner or persons in custody thereof unclaimed vehicles are to be disposed of in accordance with this city ordinances  72489 entry onto private property the chief of police or his duly authorized representative may enter upon private property for inspection or for the purpose of removing any vehicle in accordance with this division if any person refuses to allow entry onto his private property the chief of police may obtain a warrant from the proper official and proceed in accordance therewith  72489 exemptions a the provisions of this division shall not apply on the premises of a duly licensed automobile repair or sales business or on the premises of a duly licensed automobile junking yard provided that the person owning or possessing the vehicle on such premises receives a substantial portion of his annual income from the operation of such business b the provisions of this division shall not apply to vehicles stored in closed buildings  72489 housing footnotes  1  cross reference buildings ch 7  health and sanitation ch 13  licenses and business 2116 et seq article i  in general secs 1411425  reserved article ii  fair housing definitions for the purpose of this article the following terms phrases words and their derivations shall have the meanings given herein unless the context otherwise indicates financial institution means any person regularly engaged in the business of lending money or guaranteeing loans on housing accommodations or real property housing accommodation means any building or portion thereof whether such building or portion is constructed or is to be constructed which is used or intended for use as the residence or sleeping place of one 1 or more persons the term housing accommodation shall not mean or include 1 the rental of a dwelling or a portion thereof containing accommodation for no more than two 2 families one 1 of which is occupied by the owner or his family at the time of rental 2 the rental of less than four 4 rooms in a onefamily dwelling to another person by the owner or occupant of such accommodation in which he or members of his family reside 3 the sale or rental of government sponsored housing intended specifically for older persons owner means and includes the owners lessee sublessee assignee manager agent or other person firm or corporation having the right to sell rent or lease any housing accommodation or real property within the city limits person means and includes one 1 or more individuals partnerships associations organizations corporations legal representatives trustees trustees in bankruptcy or receivers real estate broker means any person who for a fee or other valuable consideration sells purchases exchanges rents negotiates offers or attempts to negotiate the sale purchase exchange or rental of housing accommodations or real property of another person real estate salesman or agent means any person employed by a real estate broker to perform or to assist in the performance of any or all of the functions of a real estate broker real property means and includes all real estate leaseholds and any vacant land offered for sale or rent unlawful discriminatory housing practice means any discrimination or segregation or separation against any person or group of persons because of race sex national origin or ancestry religion handicap or on account of the fact that a family may have children and shall include only those types of unlawful practices and acts as set forth in section 1428  101788  art 1 8194  art 1 2298 policy statement the city council hereby declares it to be the public policy of the city to eliminate discrimination and safeguard the right of any person to sell purchase lease rent or obtain financing for real property without regard to race color sex national origin or ancestry religion handicap and without regard to whether a family has children it is further declared to be the public policy of the city that the design and construction of new multifamily dwellings with four 4 or more units must meet certain adaptability and accessibility requirements to be established by the city this article shall be deemed an exercise of the police powers of the city for the protection of the public welfare prosperity health and peace of the people of the city  101788  art 1 8194  art 2 2298 unlawful practices it shall be an unlawful discriminatory housing practice 1 for the owner real estate broker real estate salesman or employee or agent thereof a to refuse to sell rent assign lease or sublease or offer for sale rental lease assignment or sublease or to refuse to negotiate for the sale rental lease assignment or sublease of any real property or portion thereof which is in fact listed or available for sale rent lease or sublease to any person who has shown the financial ability to satisfy the terms and conditions of a sale rental assignment lease or sublease of such property or to otherwise deny or withhold any housing accommodations or real property or any part or portion hereof to or from any person because of the race color sex religion national origin or ancestry or handicap of such person or because such person is the head of a household having children b to discriminate against any person because of his race color sex religion national origin or ancestry or handicap or because that person is the head of a family having children in the terms conditions or privileges of the sale lease rental assignment or sublease of any housing accommodations or real property or part or portion thereof or in the furnishing of facilities or services in connection therewith c to print publish circulate issue display post or mail or cause to be printed published circulated issued displayed posted or mailed any statement advertisement publication or sign or use any form of application for the purchase rental lease assignment or sublease of any housing accommodations or real property or part or portion thereof which expresses directly or indirectly any limitation specification or discrimination as to race color sex religion national origin or ancestry handicap or on account of the fact that such person is the head of a family having children or any intent to make any such limitation specification or discrimination 2 for any person financial institution or loan institution to which application is made for financial assistance for the purchase acquisition or construction of any housing accommodations or real property or part or portion thereof or any agent or employee thereof a to discriminate against any person because of the race color sex religion national origin or ancestry handicap of such person or because such person is the head of a family having children or of prospective occupants or tenants of such housing accommodations or real property or part or portion thereof in the granting withholding extending modifying or renewing or in the fixing of the rates terms conditions or provisions of any such financial assistance or in the extension of services in connection therewith b to use any form of application for such financial assistance or to make any record or inquiry in connection with applications for such financial assistance which expresses directly or indirectly any limitation specification or discrimination as to race sex religion national origin or ancestry handicap or on account of the fact that such applicant is the head of a family having children or any intent to make any such limitation specification or discrimination 3 for any person owner real estate broker real estate salesman or agent thereof a to discriminate against any person because of the race color sex religion national origin or ancestry handicap of such person or of prospective occupants or tenants of such housing accommodations or real property or part or portion thereof or on account of the fact that such person is the head of a family having children in the granting withholding extending modifying or renewing or in the fixing of the rates terms conditions or provisions of any such financial assistance or in the extension of services in connection therewith b to use any form of application for such financial assistance or to make any record or inquiry in connection with applications for such financial assistance which expresses directly or indirectly any limitation specification or discrimination as to race color sex religion national origin or ancestry handicap or because of the fact that such person is the head of a family having children or any intent to make any such limitation specification or discrimination 4 for any person owner real estate broker real estate salesman or agent thereof a to discriminate or to engage in economic or other reprisals against another person because such person complies with the provisions of this article or has opposed any practice forbidden under this article or has filed a complaint testified or assisted in any proceedings under this article b to aid abet incite compel coerce cooperate or participate in the doing of any act declared to be a discriminatory practice under the provisions of this article or to obstruct or prevent compliance with the provisions of this article or to attempt directly or indirectly to commit any act declared by this article to be discriminatory practice c to induce or attempt to induce the sale or listing for sale of any dwelling unit commercial unit or real property or any part or portion thereof by representing that a change has occurred or will or may occur with respect to the racial religious or ethnic composition of the block neighborhood or area in which the property is located or to induce or attempt to induce such sale by representing that the presence or anticipated presence of persons of any particular race religion sex national origin or color in the area will or may result in 1 the lowering of property values 2 the change in the racial religious or ethnic composition of the block neighborhood or area in which the property is located 3 an increase in criminal or antisocial behavior in the area 4 a decline in the quality of the schools serving the area  101788  art 1 8194  art 3 2298 exemptions nothing in this article shall prohibit a religious organization association or society or any nonprofit institution or organization organized supervised or controlled by or in conjunction with a religious organization association or society from limiting the sale rental or occupancy of dwellings which it owns or operates for other than a commercial purpose to persons of the same religion or from giving preference to such persons nor shall anything in this article prohibit a private club not in fact open to the public which as an incident to its primary purpose or purposes provides lodging which it owns or operates for other than a commercial purpose from limiting the rental or occupancy of such lodging to its members or from giving preference to its members  101788  art 1 8194 administration a any person claiming to be aggrieved of an unlawful discriminatory housing practice hereinafter referred to as complainant may on his own behalf or by his attorney make sign and file with the city clerk a complaint in writing under oath which shall state the name and address of the person alleged to have committed an unlawful discriminatory housing practice such complaint shall set forth the particulars thereof and contain such other information as may support the allegations contained therein b any complaint filed under this article must be filed within thirty 30 days after the date of the alleged incident c in the event of a complaint being filed pursuant to this section a true copy of such complaint shall forthwith be transmitted by certified united states mail postage prepaid addressed to the person complained against d the city clerk upon receipt of a complaint filed pursuant to this article and in accordance with the requirements of this article shall forthwith refer such complaint to the state commission on human rights for processing in accordance with missouri statutes  101788  art 1 8194 cross reference administration ch 2 penalties upon a finding by the state commission on human rights that any person has violated any of the provisions of this article that person shall be subject to the penalties and remedies set forth in missouri statutes as provided by an order of the state commission on human rights or a court of law all pursuant to missouri statutes  101788  art 1 8194 licenses and business regulations footnotes general definitions terms used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning architect means any person who plans or designs buildings or grounds for others or who supervises and oversees the construction alteration repair or remodeling of the same artist means any person skilled in any branch of the fine arts such as music painting or sculpture who engages in or practices such art for a consideration auctioneer means any person who shall sell or offer to sell any goods wares or merchandise or any real or personal property or any interest therein at public outcry to the highest bidder for a fee or commission auction store or company means any place stand or store where goods wares merchandise or property of any kind are regularly or frequently sold or offered for sale at public outcry to the highest bidder auto accessory dealer means any person who shall buy manufacture or assemble and sell or offer for sale any tires or other fixtures appliances or accessories to or for automobiles trucks or trailers except persons etc who are licensed as merchants automobile agency means any person who sells trades or offers to sell or trade automobiles trucks trailers or buses which are not the property of such person as the employee agent or representative of a nonresident manufacturer owner or dealer automobile dealer means any person who shall buy for the purpose of sale or trade or who shall sell trade or offer to sell or trade automobiles or motor vehicles auto wrecking shop or garage means any shop stand or place of business where automobiles or motor vehicles are dismantled wrecked remodeled repaired rebuilt for others for a consideration auto yard means any yard space or enclosure where motor vehicles are kept stored or parked for a consideration bakery means any shop stand store or place where bread cakes cookies doughnuts pies pastries andor similar products are manufactured prepared sold or offered for sale except a person licensed to do business as a merchant who sells but does not manufacture such products bank means any place of business or establishment where money andor valuables are deposited kept issued loaned andor exchanged barber means any person who for a consideration cuts or trims the hair or beard or performs any of the other services commonly offered in barbershops or offers to do so barbershop means any shop stand or place where barbers ply their trade or profession bathhouse means any building room structure or premises where for a fee or charge persons are invited and permitted to bathe swim andor dress for swimming or bathing beauty parlor means any shop room stand or place where for a consideration service substances services or things designed or intended to improve or enhance the appearance are sold or dispensed billposter means any person who shall tack nail paste or otherwise attach to billboards fences buildings or other structures any bills notices posters signs or other advertising material except legal notices issued by or under the direction of a court blacksmith shop means any shop stand or place where horses are shod andor metal is worked or fashioned or metal objects are made altered or repaired bookbinder means any person who makes binds or repairs books or pamphlets bottling works means any place or establishment where soft drinks or other liquids are prepared and bottled bowling alley means any room stand or place equipped and used for bowling or playing the game of tenpins where an admission or fee is charged brick contractor means any person who shall contract or undertake to build erect construct or repair any object structure walk or pavement with brick or to lay or place brick except his own labor broker means any person who acts or offers to act as the agent or representative of others in matters of trade commerce or navigation and receives or charges a fee or commission for such a service building contractor means any person who contracts or undertakes to erect construct raze remodel or repair any building or structure for others except a person who contracts or undertakes thereby to furnish nothing except his own labor bulk plant means any place of business handling petroleum products which have a tank or tanks for the purpose of storing petroleum products which tank or tanks have or aggregate a capacity of twenty thousand 20000 gallons or more and from which place of business petroleum products are transported either by the owner of such place of business or by any other person for the purpose of resale by any person whomsoever either at wholesale or retail butcher retail means any person who shall kill cut prepare andor sell or offer to sell any fresh meat in quantities less than onequarter of a carcass canvasser means any person who shall go from place to place or from person to person and solicit or accept orders for the within the term carnival or street fair caterer means any adult person or entity engaged in the retail sale of food and service for use at a particular function occasion or event at a particular deals in agricultural or farm products public building public grounds or public hall means any building or structure tract or space hall or room used by or for the public or public functions for a consideration readytowear clothing agency means any person who solicits or accepts orders for delivers collects or receives money for readymade clothing as the agent employee or representative of a nonresident maker or owner real estate agency means any company association joint venture copartnership or corporation which sells trades rents leases or manages or offers to sell trade rent lease or manage any real estate for others for a fee or commission and maintains a business office within the city restaurant means any inn establishment adult person or entity other than a caterer while performing catering services engaged in the retail sale of food prepared by the restaurant or by using the restaurants facilities on or off the premises and sold for immediate consumption within or away from the premises the term restaurant however shall not include entities that are exempt from federal income tax while engaged in their exempt functions and activities but shall include hospitals nursing homes and convalescent centers unless they are engaged in the preparation and delivery of food to their patients or residents runner or solicitor means any person who solicits business or customers on the streets or from place to place for steamboats cars stages taxis hotels roominghouses boardinghouses bathhouses masseurs physicians chiropractors osteopaths hospitals sanitariums or health schools sand plant means any establishment where sand andor gravel is mined pumped dug or otherwise acquired for sale or sold or offered for sale sanitarium means any establishment where for a consideration persons are kept and treated for the prevention or alleviation of diseases of the mind or body sewer contractor means any person who contracts or undertakes to build install extend rebuild or repair any sewer or system of sewers or any plant or system for the disposal of sewage except a person who undertakes to furnish nothing except his own labor sewing machine agent means any person who buys sells or deals in or offers to buy sell or deal in sewing machines as the employee agent or representative of a nonresident person or firm shoe cobbler shop means any shop stand or place where boots shoes or other footwear are repaired mended or rebuilt for others for a consideration shoe shining parlor means any room shop stand or place which does or offers to shine dye or polish shoes for others show means any exhibition or entertainment to which admission is charged or a parade or procession advertising the same sidewalk contractor means any person who contracts or undertakes to build lay install remove or repair any sidewalk or foot pavement for others for a consideration except such person who undertakes to furnish nothing except his own labor skating rink means any place where persons are invited to skate to which admission is charged soft drink stand or vendor means any person who or place where soft drinks or nonalcoholic beverages are sold or served stand means any shop booth or place where business of any kind is transacted steamfitter means any person not holding a plumbers license who installs removes repairs or offers to install remove or repair any pipe fixture or apparatus for the conveyance or use of steam stockyard means any yard pen or enclosure where livestock is held pending sale slaughter or shipment or is boarded for compensation stone contractor means any person who contracts or undertakes to cut trim or lay rock or stone or to build construct or repair any structures or objects of rock or stone except such person who undertakes to furnish nothing except his own labor storage warehouse means any building structure or place where for a consideration personal property of others of any sort or kind is stored or kept street contractor means any person who contracts or undertakes to build grade curb gutter pave repair or maintain any streets alleys or highways street exhibition means any show entertainment or exhibition held or conducted upon a public street alley highway or other public place to which admission is charged or at which goods or wares of any sort are offered for sale subcontractor means any person who contracts or undertakes at the instance of another any work which such other person has previously contracted or agreed to do or procure tailor means any person who cuts sews makes or repairs clothing to fit the customer tailormade clothing agency means any person who as the employee agent or representative of a nonresident tailor or manufacturer forwards solicits or accepts orders takes measurements makes deliveries or collects money for clothing made to fit the measurements of the purchaser tavern means any hotel public house or similar place for the accommodation or entertainment of strangers theatrical exhibition means any dramatic operatic or similar exhibition such as is usually presented or seen in a theater tinner means any person who works with tin or other sheet metal or who builds installs makes removes or repairs objects composed solely or chiefly of sheet metal traveling store means any stock of goods wares or merchandise offered for sale which is moved about from place to place within the city undertaker or funeral director means any person who undertakes to conduct funerals or care for bodies of the dead venereal hospital private means any hospital sanitarium or place where for a consideration persons suffering with venereal diseases are kept or treated except such an institution or place owned and operated by a municipal religious or charitable corporation wholesale butcher means any person who kills for sale or who sells in quantities not less than onequarter of a carcass or who sells in any quantity to retailers thereof any fresh meat or meat products wholesale merchant means any person who sells or offers to sell any goods wares or merchandise to retailers or to other persons for resale by such purchasers wood dealer means any person who buys sells or deals in wood or kindling the specification of meanings of this section shall not be exclusive and shall not be construed to exclude other matters not herein specified which are usually and ordinarily included within the various terms here defined   art 1 7698  art 1 102113 license for certain occupations businesses and tradesrequired to be in lieu of other occupational taxes a levied  method of payment every person engaged in the business of supplying telephone service for compensation within the city shall pay to the city as a license tax a sum equal to five 5 percent of all gross receipts derived from the business of supplying telephone service within the city up to twentyseven thousand five hundred dollars $2750000 per year per licensee the tax imposed by this section shall be computed and paid semiannually on january 20 and july 20 each year for the preceding full sixmonth period each such payment not to exceed thirteen thousand seven hundred fifty dollars $1375000 the respective companies shall file with the city clerk on or before each such date a verified statement showing the gross taxable revenue and accompanying tax payment of each such company applicable to the preceding sixmonth period ending june 30 and december 31 of each year b telephone service for purposes of the tax imposed in subsection a a business of supplying telephone service shall mean any business that provides telephone service within the city regardless of the technology or means of transmission including but not limited to wireless wired local exchange and internetbased transmission to the full extent permitted by applicable law c tax in lieu of other occupational taxes this tax shall be in lieu of any other occupational tax required of any person engaged in the business of supplying telephone service for compensation within this city but shall not exempt any such person from the payment to the city of any tax which the city may levy upon the real or personal property belonging to any such person or from any tax levied upon anything other than telephone service d authority of city clerk to inspect audit records the city clerk shall have the right during regular business hours to inspect and audit the books and records of any person subject to the license tax imposed by this section to confirm the correctness of the return and amount of tax required to be paid pursuant this section   art 1 11606 issuance of licenses prohibited until delinquent taxes and fees are paid  all licenses required person shall engage in operate carry on conduct or participate in doing any business in this city for which a license is required by this chapter or assist directly or indirectly in doing such business or any part of the same in any manner either as owner or proprietor or as an officer of any corporation or as manager agent superintendent servant or employee unless a license for carrying on such business shall have been issued and shall be in force b there shall be a rebuttable presumption that the licensee and such business is operating as an unlicensed business in violation of this chapter if the licensee fails to properly renew any license issued under the terms of this chapter or to notify the city clerk in writing of the closure of the business and the timely filing of all statements and payments required by section 1588 et seq of the city   art 1 12312 suspension or revocation when licensee convicted of misdemeanor when any person licensed under any provision of this the table auto wrecking and junkyards  requirements for establishing and operating no auto wrecking yard or junkyard shall be established maintained or operated within view of any public street in the city unless such auto wrecking yard or junkyard is screened from view by tight board or other screen fence in good repair not less than ten 10 feet high or of sufficient height to screen the wrecked junkyards rsmo   et seq secs 15191545  reserved article ii  merchants and manufacturers ad valorem tax footnotes  2  state law reference merchants and manufacturers licenses and taxes rsmo   et seq levy on merchants  method of computation all merchants shall pay in addition to the license tax provided in this chapter an ad valorem tax equal to that which is levied upon real estate upon the highest amount of all goods wares and merchandise which they have in their possession and under their control whether owned by them or consigned to them for sale at any time between the first monday in march and the first monday in june of each year no commission merchant is required to pay an ad valorem tax on any manufactured article the growth or produce of this or any other state which may have been consigned to him for sale and in which he has no ownership or interest other than a commission for making such sale  bond any merchant who is not required to furnish the bond specified in section 1584 shall before being issued any license in addition to paying the license tax execute a bond to the city with two 2 or more good and sufficient sureties or a recognized corporate surety conditioned that he will on or before the first day of november next following pay to the city clerk the proper ad valorem tax due to the city which bond shall be approved by the city clerk  statement of inventory  verification a required every merchant on the first monday in june of each year shall furnish to the city assessor a sworn statement of the greatest amount of goods wares and merchandise which he may have had on hand at any one 1 time between the first monday in march and the first monday in june next preceding the statement shall include goods wares and merchandise owned by such merchant or consigned to him for sale by other parties b statement to be verified such statement shall be signed and verified by such merchant or by some member of the firm copartnership or other organization before some officer authorized by law to administer oaths  levy on manufacturers  method of computation all manufacturers shall pay an ad valorem tax equal to that which is levied upon real estate upon the greatest aggregate amount of all raw materials and finished product which they may have had on hand in any one 1 day between the first monday in march and the first monday in june of each year this requirement does not apply to manufacturers whose raw material finished products tools machinery and appliances aggregate less than one thousand dollars $100000 in value  manufacturer to execute bond any manufacturer shall before being issued a license or commencing business as such manufacturer execute a bond to the city with two 2 or more good and sufficient sureties or a recognized corporate surety conditioned that he will on or before the first day of november next following pay to the city clerk the proper ad valorem tax due to the city which bond shall be approved by the city clerk  statement of raw materials products  verification a required every manufacturer doing business within the city on the first monday in june of each year shall file with the city assessor a sworn statement of the greatest aggregate amount of raw material and finished products which he may have had on hand between the first monday in march and the first monday in june next preceding on any one 1 day between such times and a sworn statement of the tools machinery and appliances used in conducting his business or owned by him on the first day of june each year b statement to be verified such statement shall be signed and verified by such manufacturer or by some member of the firm copartnership or other organization before some officer authorized by law to administer oaths  city assessor to enter statements in tax book  form and contents it shall be the duty of the city assessor to enter such statements as required in sections 1548 and 1551 in a book prepared for that purpose at the expense of the city suitably ruled with columns for the name of the merchant or manufacturer the amount of his statement to the assessor the valuation of such statement as equalized by the county board of equalization and such other columns as may be found useful or convenient in practice the book shall be verified by the affidavit of the city assessor annexed thereto in the following form to wit ___________ being duly sworn makes oath and says that he has made diligent efforts to secure sworn statements from all merchants and manufacturers doing business in the city of cape girardeau  that so far as he has been able to secure such statements they are correctly set forth in the foregoing book  tax levy based on county valuations after the county board of equalization has completed the equalization of the statement as required in sections 1548 and 1551 the valuation as fixed by the board of equalization on the county assessors merchants and manufacturers tax book shall be entered by the city assessor on the city merchants and manufacturers tax book in red ink and returned to the city council the city council shall levy taxes on the valuations as fixed by the county board of equalization at the same rate as assessed for the time on real estate and the city clerk shall extend on such books all proper taxes at such rate  and he shall on or before the first day of october make out the tax book the sum of the valuation of the statements as equalized by the county board of equalization shall be included in and made a part of the total valuation of property taxable for city purposes  forfeiture of bond  grounds a failure to file statement pay tax every merchant or manufacturer to whom a license has been issued under this article who fails to file his statement at the time and in the manner required or who has filed a correct statement and failed to pay the amount of tax owing to the city clerk shall be deemed to have forfeited the bond given by him and judgment shall be rendered for the plaintiff city in damages for double the amount of such tax and cost b false statement every merchant or manufacturer who files a false statement shall be deemed to have forfeited the bond given by him and judgment shall be rendered for the plaintiff city in damages for three 3 times the amount of tax found to be due for the year and costs  city clerk to institute suit on bond upon forfeiture upon the forfeiture of any bond as provided herein it shall be the duty of the city clerk to institute suit without delay upon the bond against the principal and sureties jointly or severally as may be deemed advisable  statement of merchant manufacturer to be used as evidence in suit upon bonds in all suits upon bonds a certified copy of the statement required to be filed in the office of the city clerk under his seal of office shall be evidence of the amount of taxes due from such merchant or manufacturer so filing the same  but the city may show by competent testimony that such statement does not contain the full amount of taxable property required to be returned when no statement has been filed he may show by such testimony the amount of taxable property that should have been returned  penalty for knowingly filing false statement any merchant or manufacturer who knowingly files a false statement under this article shall in addition to forfeiting his bond as provided for in section 1554 upon conviction forfeit his license and be punished by a fine of not less than twentyfive dollars $2500 nor more than five hundred dollars $50000 or by imprisonment for a period not exceeding three 3 months  license  duration  restrictions no license granted under this chapter shall authorize any merchant or manufacturer to engage in his business at more than one 1 place within the city nor for a longer period than twelve 12 months  businesses commencing during year  requirements  computation of tax a bond required when any merchant or manufacturer commences his business in this city after the first monday in june in any year he shall execute a bond conditioned that he will on the first day of november next succeeding furnish to the city assessor a statement verified as herein required of the largest amount of goods wares or merchandise or raw materials and finished products tools machinery and appliances which he had on hand or subject to his control whether owned by him or consigned to him for sale on the first day of any month between the time when he commenced business and the first day of november next succeeding b computation of tax he shall pay the same rate of tax as other merchants and manufacturers prorated from the day when he commenced business to the first monday in june next succeeding  secs 15601580  reserved article iii  gross sales license tax footnotes  3  state law reference city sales tax act rsmo   et seq annotation in proceeding by automobile dealer to annul provisions of enacted  imposing a tax determined by the annual gross receipts for previous year court held ordinance unconstitutional where different measures for the tax were imposed upon automobile dealers who had not been engaged in such business during previous calendar year and upon automobile dealers who had been engaged in such business during preceding calendar year cape girardeau v groves motor co 346 mo 762 142 sw 2d 1040 1930 gross sales defined for the purposes of this article the term gross sales shall mean the gross receipts of the business occupation or calling for which the license was issued either sale of merchandise or sale of services or derived of the licensee whether such sales services or transactions are for cash or on credit  levied  license required there is hereby levied a license tax upon the privilege of engaging within the city in any of the following named occupations or businesses or doing or operating any of the following named things auto agency tavern retail oil station no person shall engage in any of the occupations or conduct any of the businesses or do or operate any of the things mentioned in this section without first obtaining a license therefor  application for license every person engaging in any business enumerated in the preceding section shall make application to the city clerk for a license  licensee required to give bond  city clerk to approve upon making such application for a license the applicant shall deliver to the city clerk the sum of ten dollars $1000 and a bond signed by two 2 good and sufficient sureties who shall be residents of the city the bond shall be approved by the city clerk and shall be conditioned upon the payment of the license tax  cross reference deputy city clerks  255 form and of bond for failure to pay tax every licensee who fails to pay his license tax shall be deemed to have forfeited the bond given and upon the forfeiture of any bond it shall be the duty of the city clerk to notify the city attorney who shall without delay institute suit upon the bond in the name of the city against the principal and sureties thereon  issuance of license  duration upon receipt of the ten dollars $1000 and approval of the bond the city clerk shall issue a license to the applicant granting the applicant the privilege of engaging in the business specified for a period of one 1 year commencing on january 1 of each year current licenses expiring after  shall be reissued on  for a period of one 1 year and credit shall be given for the unused portion of the current license fee current licenses expiring after the effective date of this ordinance but before  shall be renewed only from their anniversary date to  thereafter all renewals of licenses shall be made on january 1 of each year persons securing licenses after january 1 of any year shall pay for such portion of the license year remaining at the time such license is issued   art 3 7698 licensees to furnish annual statement of gross receipts to city clerk within five 5 days after the close of the year for which a license is issued the licensee shall file with the city clerk in a manner and form to be prescribed by the clerk and upon blanks furnished by him a statement showing the amount of gross receipts for sales services and transactions by such licensee during the year for which the license was issued such statement shall be verified by the affidavit of the licensee or his officer or agent  tax schedule at the close of the year for which the license is issued the licensee shall pay for the license as follows 1 gross sales less than $1000000 where the annual gross sales of such licensee derived from his business occupation or calling have amounted to less than ten thousand dollars $1000000 during the year for which the license was issued the sum of ten dollars $1000 2 gross sales more than $1000000 where the annual gross sales of such licensee derived from his business occupation or calling have amounted to more than ten thousand dollars $1000000 during the year for which the license was issued the sum of ten dollars $1000 for the first ten thousand dollars $1000000 and one dollar $100 for each one thousand dollars $100000 or fractional part thereof in excess of ten thousand dollars $1000000 3 licensee to receive $1000 credit the licensee shall receive as a credit on the license tax the ten dollars $1000 delivered to the city clerk at the time the license was issued  determination of daily gross sales the amount of the daily gross sales for the license year shall be fixed on the amount filed and sworn to by the licensee or on the amount determined by the city clerk or his agent from the inspection and audit of the licensees records and books whichever is the greater  computation of gross sales when payments to licensee in merchandise for the purposes of this article the value of any goods wares and merchandise accepted by any licensee as part of the purchase price of goods wares and merchandise sold or transferred by such licensee shall not be considered in determining gross sales but the amount realized from the sale by the licensee of such goods wares and merchandise so accepted shall be included in the gross sales of the year such goods wares and merchandise are sold this section applies to the sale by the licensee of any article accepted by such licensee for partial payment of the purchase price the value of any article so accepted shall be the allowance or credit given the person offering such article to the licensee as a partial payment  computation of gross sales for business terminated during year if any licensee does not remain in business for the full year the license tax shall be figured on the gross sales for the period such licensee remained in business on the basis provided for in this article  city clerk authorized to inspect licensees records books all persons obtaining a license as herein provided shall at any time during regular business hours permit the city clerk or his agent to make an inspection and audit of the records and books of such licensee for the purpose of determining the correctness of the affidavit filed by such licensee the information and data obtained from such inspection and audit shall not be disclosed by the city clerk or his agent  but this section shall not prohibit the city clerk or his agent from giving evidence in court in any proceeding brought to collect any license tax provided for in this section or to punish any licensee for the making of a false or fraudulent affidavit  secs 159415115  reserved article iv  capital improvements sales tax imposition  rules regulations there is hereby imposed upon all sellers a tax for the privilege of engaging in the business of selling taxable personal property or rendering taxable services at retail to the extent and in the manner provided in rsmo  and the rules and regulations of the director of revenue issued pursuant thereto at the rate of onefourth of one 1 percent on all retail sales made in the city which are subject to taxation under the provisions of rsmo  this tax is imposed pursuant to rsmo  and to the extent provided in rsmo  and the rules and regulations of the director of revenue issued pursuant thereto  91988 purpose the tax imposed by this article is for the limited purpose of funding capital improvements for flood control drainage improvement and storm water control projects and may include the retirement of debt under previously authorized bonded indebtedness for such limited purposes this tax shall be in addition to any and all other sales taxes allowed by law  91988 trust fund there is hereby established a city capital improvements trust fund all moneys received by the city from the capital improvements sales tax imposed by this article shall be deposited by the finance director to the credit of this fund and used in accordance with state statute  91988 when effective duration the tax authorized by this article shall become effective on the first day of january 1990 and such tax shall continue for a period of ten 10 years from its date of inception and thereafter shall automatically terminate unless extended or renewed in accordance with law  91988 condition precedent  use of proceeds this article shall become effective only in the event that the united states congress appropriates construction funds for the cape lacroixwalker creek flood control project previously authorized by the water resources development act of 1986 and described in the united states army corps of engineers cape girardeaujackson metropolitan area missouri feasibility report dated december 1983 if the voters of this city approve this tax and if the united states congress appropriates construction funds as set out herein the funds derived from the imposition of this tax shall be used primarily for the cape lacroix creekwalker creek flood control project but the use of the funds shall not be limited to such project but may be allocated to other flood control drainage improvement and stormwater control projects as determined by the city council funds derived from the imposition of this tax may also be used for capital improvements for parks and recreational purposes but only to the extent that such parks and recreational purposes are directly related to and incidental to the cape lacroix creekwalker creek flood control project  91988 tax extended pursuant to section 15119 and the election held on  the tax authorized by this article is extended effective on the first day of january 200 with such tax to terminate on  unless otherwise extended or renewed in accordance with law for the purpose of funding capital improvements for flood control drainage improvement stormwater control projects and for other capital improvement projects to be designated by the cape girardeau city council  6396 secs 1512215145  reserved article v  amusements footnotes  4  state law reference authority of city to levy license tax on amusements rsmo    shows circuses amusement buildings and festivals rsmo   et seq defined  exception a for the purpose of this article the following are declared to be amusements 1 pinball machine which includes any machine which is operated by placing any piece of money coin token slug or instrumentality of any kind into the machine whereupon a ball or balls are released which balls can then be projected or propelled by the operator or player of such machine 2 any machine or table of any kind or description which can be played or operated by placing therein any piece of money coin token slug or instrumentality and which machine is set up in any place for public use for the amusement or enjoyment of the person playing or using the machine b music machines and juke boxes shall not be considered amusements under this article  license required no person shall engage in operate or conduct an amusement without first obtaining a license therefor  application for license  contents an applicant for a license for the operation of an amusement shall submit to the city clerk a signed and sworn application upon the letterhead of the applicant setting forth the name and address of applicant whether applicant is operating as an individual partnership or corporation and a list of the machines owned by the applicant together with the exact location of the machine on the date of the filing of the application  issuance of license by city clerk upon filing of the application and payment of the license tax the city clerk shall issue to such owner or operator a license like that issued in the case of other businesses or occupations  levy of tax  amount there is hereby levied an annual license tax of forty dollars $4000 upon any person owning or operating amusements within the city   art 3 102113 sign posted on premises each amusement referred to in this article when set up or operated in the city shall bear a sign thereon which shall clearly indicate the name and address of the operator thereof  confiscation of unlicensed machine  assessment of costs no person shall have on his premises any machine capable of being used by any other person than the owner or operator upon which a license tax has not been paid and in such an event the machine may be confiscated and held by the police department until the license tax and all costs incident to the confiscation and all fines and costs which may be assessed by the municipal judge of the city against the owner or the person upon whose premises the machine was located are paid in full  reserved editors note the provisions of  1680 of the 1967 included in this  were repealed by art 1 adopted nov 19 1990 such provisions pertained to the operation of certain amusements on sundays secs 1515415175  reserved article vi  pawnbrokers footnotes  5  state law reference pawnbrokers rsmo    et seq license required  license tax fee no person shall carry on the business of pawnbroker within the limits of this city without a license the license tax for such license is forty dollars $4000 per year   art 4 102113 bond required  approval by city clerk before any license to conduct the business of pawnbroker is issued to any person he must in addition to paying the license tax have entered into a bond to the city with two 2 or more good and sufficient sureties in the sum of five hundred dollars $50000 conditioned that he will observe all ordinances respecting pawnbrokers which bond shall be approved by the city clerk  interest on loans  limitation no pawnbroker shall charge or receive more than two 2 percent per month on any loan  unlawful to receive goods of minor no pawnbroker junk dealer or dealer in secondhand goods or merchandise nor any employee of such pawnbroker dealer or merchant shall buy receive or take any personal property goods wares or merchandise other than agricultural products of any value from any minor or have in his possession any personal property goods wares or merchandise so had and obtained    31692 pawnbrokers and secondhand dealers a definitions junkscrap manufactured articles or parts that have been discarded or are useful only as material for reprocessing or recycling licensee the owneroperator and all employees of a business licensed under this article pawnbroker every owner operator or employee engaged in the businesses of receiving property in pledge or as security for money or other things advanced to pawner or pledger shall be deemed to be a pawnbroker secondhand dealer every owner operator or employee engaged in the business of the purchase sale or barter of secondhand articles including but not limited to recyclable materials scrap metal electronics video game systemsvideo gamesvideo game accessories jewelry valuable andor precious metals and stones or household goods shall be deemed to be a secondhand dealer whether such dealer operates from a fixed storefront business or is conducting business on a temporary shortterm basis from a nonfixed location b exemptions this section shall not apply to the purchase or sale of used motor vehicles including motorcycles motor driven cycles as defined by missouri state statute nor shall it apply to charitable organizations that accept donated goods for resale as a fundraising program for the charity in addition the following businesses are also exempt from the persons or requirements of this section 1 those businesses that had obtained a city business license prior to  whose primary business involves the purchase sale or barter of jewelry precious stones precious metals collectible coins andor currency 2 those establishments whose primary source of business derives from antique items generally consisting in age of twenty 20 years or more andor those establishments whose primary source of business derives from the purchase sale or barter of articles of clothing 3 gun and knife shows auction or asset liquidation services engaged in the selling of the contents of an estate c electronic reporting of transactions the cape giradeau police department shall enter into a contract for service and maintain its contract for service with leadsonline or a similar entity as designated by the chief of police in order to enhance its investigative services to protect both pawnbrokerssecondhand dealers and members of the general public in the event of a change to its electronic reporting system the city will notify all impacted licensees of the change within a reasonable time prior to such change every pawnbroker or secondhand dealer shall operate and maintain a computer system with internet access and photographic or video capability sufficient for the electronic reporting requirements described in this article any failure or malfunction of such equipment on the part of the licensee shall not exempt the licensee from the recordingreporting requirements outlined in this section the licensee shall immediately notify the police department of any such failure or malfunction and shall have such resolved as soon as practical failure by the licensee to resolve any failure or malfunction of equipment in a reasonable amount of time will lead to license revocation proceedings under this article d record of transactions throughout the term of the license every pawnbroker or secondhand dealer shall reportupload to leadsonline or the citys current electronic reporting system the below listed information for each and every transaction conducted during each day they were open for business by the end of that business day all information shall be recorded in the english language a transaction shall consist of all articles brought in to a pawnbroker or secondhand dealer for sale barter trade pledge or pawn by an individual pawnerseller at one specific time and date articles brought in to a pawnbroker or secondhand dealer by an individual pawnerseller for sale barter trade pledge or pawn at different times or different dates by the same person shall be considered as separate transactions regardless of how short the difference in time is between those transactions separate transactions either from the same person or different persons shall not be combined and reported collectively 1 nonjunkscrap articles a purchasesreceipts by licensee i all nonjunkscrap articles brought in to a pawnbroker or secondhand dealer by an individual pawnerseller for sale barter trade pledge or pawn during a single transaction shall be itemized separately 1 exemption collectible coins antiquecollectible currency gold or silver necklaces gold or silver bracelets may be lumped into one 1 entry per specified item example twelve 12 silver dollars nine 9 twentyinch gold braided necklaces provided that each item is identifiable in a single or group photograph ii each nonjunkscrap article brought in to a pawnbroker or secondhand dealer by an individual pawnerseller for sale barter trade pledge or pawn during a transaction shall be associated with the person pawnerseller who brought the article in the licensee shall recordreport the following information for each such transaction 1 a digital photographic image of a photo id card of the pawnerseller sufficiently clear to allow the information on the id to be read the photo id must be currently valid not expired or mutilated card issued by a government entity of the united states and must include the pawnerseller s first and last name current address date of birth and physical descriptors in the event the card is valid but does not contain the pawnersellers current address the licensee must separately record and report the current address 2 if the pawnerseller is pawning or selling on behalf of a company or business the name address and telephone number of such company or business shall also be recordedreported 3 the date and time of the transaction 4 a complete and thorough description of each nonjunkscrap article including but not limited to the following a type of article b brand namemakemanufacturer if applicable c model number if applicable d serial number if applicable e colorfinish 5 a digital photographs of each nonjunkscrap article purchased or received as trade barter pledge or pawn by a pawnbroker or secondhand dealer sufficiently detailed to allow reasonable identification of each article if the article contains any identifying numbers marks writing engraving etc or any other distinguishing characteristics the digital images shall capture the same b sales by the licensees i all nonjunkscrap articles sold by a pawnbroker or secondhand dealer to an individual shall be itemized separately licensees shall not lump nonjunkscrap article together example two 2 gold necklaces four 4 gold earrings and must individually itemize and describe each individual article ii each nonjunkscrap article sold by a pawnbroker or secondhand dealer shall be associated with the person to whom it was sold the licensee shall recordreport the following information for each such transaction 1 the name and current address of the purchaser must be recordedreported  a photographic image of a governmentissued photo id card is not necessary 2 a digital photograph of nonjunk scrap articles sold by a pawnbroker or secondhand dealer to an individual is not required 2 junkscrap articles a purchase by licensees i junkscrap articles may be recordedreported in bulk but must specify the weight type example steel copper aluminum etc and form example sheet cans pipe wire etc of the bulk material ii each different type and form of junkscrap bulk material brought in to a secondhand dealer by an individual for sale during a transaction shall be associated with the person who brought the material in licensees shall record report the following information for each such transaction 1 a photographic image on the id card of the seller sufficiently clear to allow the information on the id to be read the photo id must be a currently valid not expired card issued by a government entity of the united states and must include the pawnersellers first and last name current address date of birth and physical descriptors in the event the card is valid but does not contain the sellers current address the licensee must separately record and report the current address 2 if the seller is selling on behalf of a company or business the name address and telephone number of such company or business shall also be recordedreported 3 if the junkscrap is brought by motor vehicle to a licensee for sale the make model color and license plate number of that vehicle shall be recordedreported 4 the date and time of the transaction 5 a digital photograph or if the licensee has a video system video segment of each individual type and form of bulk material purchased by the licensee shall be linked to the record of that transaction b sales of licensees i licensees do not need to recordreport any information pertaining to the sale of junkscrap material e written records in event of electronic reporting system malfunction in the event the electronic reporting system malfunctions or is otherwise not operational the licensee shall at all times during such malfunction or nonoperation be required to keep written records of any and all transactions made during the period of malfunction or nonoperation to include all information required by this section these written records shall be recordeduploaded to
