from art 1 adopted   and art 1 adopted dec 17 2012 streets to be public all new streets constructed in the city shall be public streets constructed to the street standards contained in this article if requested by the developer and approved by the city manager new local streets may be privately owned and maintained but must still be constructed to the street standards contained in this article private streets shall be subject to inspection by the city and inspection fees shall be paid by the developer private streets shall be dedicated to public use new private streets if approved by the city manager may have gates to limit access only if the following minimum standards are met a a system for entry by emergency and maintenance personnel is provided as approved by the city manager b gates shall be a minimum of fourteen 14 feet wide  art 1 3716 street names proposed streets which are continuations of or in general alignment with existing named streets shall bear the names of such existing streets unless otherwise authorized by the city manager the name of a proposed street which is not in alignment with an existing street shall not duplicate the name of any existing or platted street within the city all proposed street names shall be subject to approval by the city manager art 1 3716 street numbering system a number required every building in the city shall be assigned a street address on the street to which the front of the building is oriented for the purpose of a proper distribution of numbers there shall be allotted one 1 number to each space of twenty 20 feet frontage or fractional part thereof for subdivisions originally platted within the county the county system of addressing shall be continued including the allotment of one 1 number to each space of ten and onehalf 1012 feet frontage b buildings on streets running north and south in numbering the buildings on streets running north and south the numbering shall begin at independence street as a dividing street from water street to farrar drive as a dividing street south to william street route k as a dividing street from interstate 55 westward the even numbers shall be on the east side and the odd numbers shall be on the west side the numbering shall be continued in each block on streets lying north and south of the dividing streets respectively  the number of the second block shall begin with number  the third block with the number  and continue in the same manner until all the buildings are numbered reserving consecutive numbers for vacant spaces of twenty 20 feet for subdivisions originally platted within the county the county system of numbering shall be continued including reserving consecutive numbers for vacant spaces of ten and onehalf 1012 feet as noted above c buildings on streets running east and west in numbering the buildings in blocks situated on streets running east and west the numbering shall begin at the eastern edge of the city limits and the same rules shall govern the numbering as provided above except that the even numbers shall be on the north side of the street and the odd numbers shall be on the south side of the street d numbering of multitenant buildings 1 in buildings oriented in an eastwest direction the easternmost unit shall begin with number  and increase sequentially to the westernmost unit buildings with a central corridor shall alternate with even numbers on the north side of the building and odd numbers on the south side of the building 2 in buildings oriented in a northsouth direction located north of the dividing line defined in section 25904b the southernmost unit shall begin with number  and increase sequentially to the northernmost unit buildings with a central corridor shall alternate with even numbers on the east side of the building and odd numbers on the west side of the building 3 in buildings oriented in a northsouth direction located south of the dividing line defined in section 25904b the northernmost unit shall begin with number  and increase sequentially to the southernmost unit buildings with a central corridor shall alternate with even numbers on the east side of the building and odd numbers on the west side of the building 4 in multistory buildings the first floor units shall be numbered beginning with  the second floor units shall be numbered beginning with  and so forth e address numbers posted it shall be the duty of the owners and occupants of each residential building in the city to have placed thereon in a place visible from the street address numbers at least four 4 inches high or reflective white numbers at least three 3 inches high on a reflective background showing the correct number of the building it shall be the duty of the owners and occupants of each nonresidential building in the city to have placed thereon two 2 sets of address numbers at least six 6 inches high showing the correct number of the building one 1 set shall be visible from the street and the other set visible from the rear of the building where there is access to the rear of the building from a street alley or parking area or where there is a rear entrance to or exit from the building or where exceptional circumstances exist as determined by the city manager all address numbers shall be in arabic numerals of a color contrasting with that of the building script numbers shall not be permitted except as an auxiliary to the address numbers themselves painting of address numbers on the street curb is not permitted art 1 3716 survey monuments survey monuments shall be placed by a land surveyor at all street corners as further described in the citys standards and specifications and so located to find angle points points of tangency of curves on one 1 side of the street and at all boundary corners should conditions prohibit the placing of any monuments at the above locations offsetting of the permanent marker is permitted  provided however that exact offstreet courses and distances are shown on the record plat monuments shall meet the state standards for survey monuments all proposed developments shall be tied to a missouri state plane monument all coordinates shall be shown on a record plat or accompanying documents no coordinates are to be assumed art 1 3716 street standards the arrangement character extent width grade and location of all streets shall be considered in their relation to existing and proposed streets to topographical conditions to public convenience and safety and in their appropriate relation to the proposed uses of the land to be served by such streets the following standards shall apply in addition to the citys standard specifications and drawings a arrangements of streets shall reasonably conform as nearly as possible to the major street plan and the developer shall make provisions for the extension of arterial collector and local streets except for loop or culdesac streets streets shall connect with streets already established or provide for future connections to adjoining unsubdivided tracts or shall be a reasonable projection of streets in adjacent tracts b reserved strips of land which control or limit access at the terminus of streets are prohibited c a tangent of at least one hundred 100 feet long shall be introduced between reverse curves on arterial and collector streets d streets shall intersect other streets with an angle of ninety 90 degrees extending a minimum distance of one hundred 100 feet unless the city manager approves a minor deviation e a minimum radius of twentytwo 22 feet at a street rightofway intersection and a minimum radius of thirtytwo 32 feet at the back of the curb shall be required greater radii may be required at the intersection and at the back of the curb of a street with an arterial street the city manager may permit comparable cutoffs or chords in lieu of rounded corners at street rightofway intersections f all streets intersecting on arterial or collector streets shall be directly opposite existing or other proposed streets or shall be a minimum of three hundred 300 feet distant as measured between street centerlines local street intersection jogs or discontinuities with centerline offsets of less than two hundred 200 feet shall be avoided g streets shall be constructed to the citys standard specifications and drawings h all streets in excess of one hundred fifty 150 feet in length shall be provided with a turnaround culdesac or hammerhead as specified in the citys standard specifications and drawings temporary turnarounds culdesacs and hammerheads may be allowed for a maximum of two 2 years after which time permanent pavement must be constructed the two 2 year period begins on the date the city council accepts the street infrastructure permanent pavement shall be constructed within fortyfive 45 days following expiration of the two 2 year period the developer shall execute an escrow agreement with the city for the permanent pavement improvements i all streets shall be designed to meet the minimum requirements set forth in the citys standard specifications and drawings rightofway and pavement widths may vary as warranted based on the functions of the type of street and the corresponding intensity of use street classifications may be indicated on the major street plan or determined by the city manager j radius of curve superelevation rates of vertical curvature kvalues and all other design parameters of streets not specifically listed shall be designed in accordance to the most current version of the aashto geometric design of highways and streets k the use of traffic calming methods within developments is encouraged including the utilization of curves islands intersections andor other methods that allow adequate access but promote traffic calming the use of speed bumps is prohibited l for arterial streets a sight distance triangle shall be provided at every intersection in accordance with the most current version of the aashto geometric design of highways and streets the sight distance triangle shall be measured from the outside edge of the travel lane landscaping shall be limited to a maximum height of eighteen 18 inches within the sight distance triangle there shall be no parking or driveways in the sight distance triangle for sight distance triangle requirements for collector and local streets refer to the citys standard specifications and drawings art 1 3716 street improvements whenever a development or redevelopment is proposed on a property adjacent to a public street the city shall require the developer to make improvements to the street as necessary to ensure proper traffic flow and safety necessary improvements may include but are not limited to turn lanes deceleration lanes lanes and traffic signals the city may require the property owner to dedicate additional rightofway for the necessary improvements all costs pertaining to the necessary improvements and the dedication of additional rightofway shall be paid by the developer all improvements shall conform to the citys standard specifications and drawings as well as the major street plan art 1 3716 stormwater management the use of porous and permeable pavement rain gardens permeable pavers and native vegetation are encouraged in order to minimize the amount of impervious surfaces within the city storm drainage improvements shall consist of storm sewers which shall adequately drain the areas being developed open channels may be permitted with approval by the city manager the design of drainage improvements shall be coordinated to the extent possible with present and probable future improvements so as to form part of an integrated system adequate provisions shall be made for the disposal of stormwater in accordance with the specifications ordinances and standards of the city and subject to the inspection and approval of the city manager art 1 3716 street lighting street lights shall be provided as part of any development or redevelopment involving new public streets the location design and installation of street lights shall be in accordance with the citys standard specifications and drawings nonstandard street lights may be approved by the city manager new light fixtures shall be located on existing poles where practical street lights shall be installed at the time new streets are constructed the developer shall be responsible for all costs pertaining to the installation of street lights art 1 3716 bicycle routes preferred routes for bicyclists are designated on the citys major street plan consideration for bicyclists could include a wider travel lane marked bike paths or multimodal paths bicycle lanes are required along arterial streets with consideration given to other streets the minimum width for bicycle lanes on a street with no onstreet parking is four 4 feet the minimum width for bicycle lanes on a street with onstreet parking is five 5 feet which should be located between the travel lane and the parking areas all bicycle lanes shall be designed constructed posted marked and striped according to the citys standard specifications and drawings art 1 3716 sidewalks and trails a sidewalks required at the time street improvements are installed or the development or redevelopment of property occurs sidewalks shall be provided in accordance with the citys standard specifications and drawings no certificate of occupancy shall be issued until such time the city has determined the sidewalks to be in acceptable condition if sidewalks are escrowed for a project the curb ramps must be installed at the time the street improvements are constructed a public access easement of appropriate width shall be granted for all public sidewalks and trails not located in rightofway the requirement for sidewalks may be waived under one 1 or more of the following circumstances as approved by the city manager 1 the street or property has access to an existing trail that conforms to the citys standard specifications and drawings  2 there are no existing sidewalks within five hundred 500 feet of the street or property  or 3 there exist topographical constraints on the street or property such that sidewalks are not feasible b abandoned driveways  replacement with curb gutter and sidewalk whenever a driveway is abandoned or otherwise taken out of use the property owner shall remove the driveway in its entirety and install new curb gutter andor sidewalk as approved by the city manager and in accordance with the citys standard specifications and drawings the property owner shall be responsible for all costs pertaining to the installation of the curb gutter andor sidewalk c removal of curb from radius portion of curb at intersecting streets in constructing a driveway no curb shall be removed from any radius portion of a curb at intersecting streets if a sidewalk exists or is planned to be installed at such location in the future d no excavation or fill in rightofway without plan approval and permit excavation or placement of fill material in a street rightofway is prohibited unless plans for such work have been approved and a permit issued in accordance with the provisions of chapter 24 article v art 1 3716 driveways spacing requirements for the minimum distance between driveways shall be per the citys standard specifications and drawings sidewalks constructed within a driveway shall be in accordance with the citys standard specifications and drawings all driveways shall be constructed with an ada compliant sidewalk crossing whether or not a sidewalk connection is made a common driveways common driveways serving two 2 adjacent lots may be allowed subject to the same width requirements as any other driveway cross access easements shall be provided in accordance with section 251002 a b multifamily residential and nonresidential driveway throat length driveway throats for multifamily residential and nonresidential uses shall be of sufficient length so as to prevent inbound traffic queues from backing onto a street the throat length shall also provide sufficient space for exiting vehicles to queue provide better definition of the driving lanes and establish separation between the parking area and the adjacent street driveway throat lengths shall meet the following requirements and shall be based on the ultimate street section anticipated 1 all driveways shall provide at least fifty 50 feet of throat length adjacent to local and collector streets and one hundred 100 feet adjacent to arterial streets 2 for driveways serving between one hundred 100 and four hundred 400 vehicles in the peak hour twoway traffic volumes the driveways shall provide at least one hundred twentyfive 125 feet of throat length 3 for driveways serving over four hundred 400 vehicles per hour twoway traffic volume and for all driveways controlled by a traffic signal adequate throat length shall be determined by a transportation traffic study 4 for driveways serving extremely low volumes ten 10 vehicles or less in the peak hours on low volume streets less than one hundred 100 vehicles existing or projected in any hour low speed twentyfive 25 miles per hour or less speed limit streets a throat depth of thirty 30 feet may be permitted at the city managers discretion c accommodation of pedestrians all driveways serving multifamily residential or nonresidential uses must adequately accommodate pedestrians using sidewalks unless waived by the city manager in accordance with section 259101 d accommodation of bicycles where a new driveway serving a multifamily residential or nonresidential use crosses a bicycle facility such as a dedicated bike path or an onstreet bike lane the driveway shall be designed so as to accommodate the safe crossing of bicyclists where a new bicycle facility crosses a driveway the bicycle facility shall be designed in a manner that provides a safe crossing for bicyclists e driveway extensions every driveway shall extend to a garage carport or parking area adjacent to such driveway f culverts culverts shall be required in accordance with the citys standards and specifications the property owner or developer shall be responsible for all costs pertaining to the installation maintenance and replacement of culverts art 1 3716 secs 25912251000  reserved article x  access management footnotes  6  editors note art 2 adopted  repealed the former art x  251001251006 and enacted a new article as set out hundred eighty 180 days from the date of approval art 2 3716 standards a cross access in order to minimize connections on arterial streets adjacent multifamily residential or nonresidential uses shall provide a cross access drive and pedestrian access way to allow circulation between adjacent developments this requirement shall also apply to a building site that abuts an existing developed property property owners shall record all necessary easements and agreements including an easement allowing cross access to and from the adjacent properties and a joint maintenance agreement defining maintenance responsibilities of property owners that share the cross access system b truck movements driveways and internal circulation systems shall be designed to accommodate the largest truck anticipated to serve the development vehicle turning paths shall be provided such that trucks do not encroach over curbs and medians any encroachment into opposing turning lanes should be minimized and should be consistent with the scale of the development and the frequency and timing of truck movements truck circulation development site should minimize conflicts with customer traffic loading docks should be configured such that parked trucks do not impede normal traffic flow c restrictive medians restrictive medians shall prohibit vehicles from crossing the median except at designated median openings restrictive medians shall provide refuge for pedestrians at intersections and shall be ada accessible a restrictive median shall be required on any portion of an arterial street where all of the following conditions exist 1 the street has four 4 or more total lanes  2 the posted speed limit is fortyfive 45 mph or above  3 the street has left turn lanes at signalized intersections where driveways are present within the intersection functional area  4 the street has dual left turn lanes d median openings the minimum spacing standards for full median openings shall be onequarter 14 mile subject to the limitations below 1 median openings shall not be permitted within the functional area of an interchange 2 median openings shall not be permitted where an opening would be unsafe due to inadequate sight distance requirements 3 directional median openings may be provided at any connection that meets the connection spacing requirements 4 left turn lanes shall be required at all median openings median openings shall not be permitted where adequate queue storage cannot be provided for the left turn lanes e connection spacing connections to arterial streets shall conform to the following requirements 1 connections shall be located outside of any interchange or intersection functional areas 2 connections shall provide sufficient separation to accommodate warranted or required turn lanes 3 connections shall be aligned with existing or planned connectors on the opposite side of the street except where movements are limited to right turns in and right turns out 4 if offset from connections on the opposite side of the street where no restrictive median is in place minimum separations measured from centerline to centerline shall be a arterial five hundred thirty 530 feet  b collector two hundred fifty 250 feet  c leftin only movements must be controlled use of a restrictive median 5 connections to limited access streets as identified on the street classifications map shall be streets only and not driveways into individual properties the connection spacing for these streets shall conform with the following table undivided street divided street all movements right turn in right turn out directional opening 990 2640 feet 1320 2640 feet 330 990 feet 660 1320 feet range to be determined by the city manager typically designed for left turns from the major roadway or left turns and uturns f twltl continuous twoway left turn lanes are discouraged but shall be considered for 1 collector streets adjacent to property that is developed as or planned for commercial development 2 areas where there is a need for frequent left turn lanes art 2 3716 driveway spacing requirements  multifamily residential and nonresidential uses for multifamily residential and
